intro: Leptaloe johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's leptaloe, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically pink or reddish in color. The plant has a short stem and produces small, leathery leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is considered endangered due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
